author: Special Correspondent
text:
The work of re-laying of roads dug for the execution of underground drainage, laying of power cables and drinking water pipelines will be taken up and completed soon, said Edappadi K. Palanisamy, Minister for State Highways and Minor Ports.

The Government has earmarked a sum of Rs. 74 crore for the re-laying of dug up roads in all the 60 wards in the city limits and the works will be taken up shortly, the Minister said while speaking at a function to distribute freebies at Ammapettai here on Saturday.

Drinking water scheme

The Minister said on the close heels of the completion of the first phase of the Salem drinking water scheme, the works on the second phase have already been taken up. The completion of the second phase will ensure potable drinking water supply in the corporation limits once in two days.

He explained the various development projects and welfare programmes implemented by the State Government for the uplift of the poor and downtrodden and called upon the people to extend their full cooperation and support to the government.

V. Sampath, Collector, presided over the meeting. S. Soundappan, Mayor, V. Panneerselvam, MP and others spoke.

The Minister gave away free mixers, grinders and table fans to 4,063 families.

The Minister also inaugurated the distribution of free Pongal dhotis and saris on the occasion.
title: Roads to be re-laid soon: Minister
